channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Business Automation Workflow
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Business Automation Workflow

item.title: CVE-2019-4424|2024-09-17T03:55:04.241Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0.0.0, 18.0.0.1, 18.0.0.2, 19.0.0.1, and 19.0.0.2 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 162770.

item.title: CVE-2021-29834|2024-09-17T01:56:18.120Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0.0.0, 18.0.0.1, 18.0.0.2, 19.0.0.1, 19.0.0.2, 19.0.0.3,20.0.0.1, 20.0.0.2, and 21.0.2 and IBM Business Process Manager 8.5 and 8.6 are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 204832.

item.title: CVE-2018-1885|2024-09-17T00:25:32.046Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0.0.0, 18.0.0.1, and 18.0.0.2 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitve information using a specially cracted HTTP request. IBM X-Force ID: 152020.

item.title: CVE-2019-4045|2024-09-17T01:56:35.278Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow and IBM Business Process Manager 18.0.0.0, 18.0.0.1, and 18.0.0.2 provide embedded document management features. Because of a missing restriction in an API, a client might spoof the last modified by value of a document. IBM X-Force ID: 156241.

item.title: CVE-2019-4669|2024-09-17T02:16:45.588Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Process Manager 8.5.7.0 through 8.5.7.0 2017.06, 8.6.0.0 through 8.6.0.0 CF2018.03, and IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0.0.1 through 19.0.0.3 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 171254.

item.title: CVE-2021-29878|2024-09-17T01:36:37.802Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0, 19.0, 20.0, and 21.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 206581.

item.title: CVE-2021-38900|2024-09-17T01:40:57.148Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Process Manager 8.5 and 8.6 and IBM Business Automation Workflow 18.0, 19.0, 20.0 and 21.0 could allow a privileged user to obtain highly sensitive information due to improper access controls. IBM X-Force ID: 209607.

item.title: CVE-2020-4672|2024-09-17T04:20:42.179Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 20.0.0.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 186285.

item.title: CVE-2024-38321|2024-08-03T13:34:16.845Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 22.0.2, 23.0.1, 23.0.2, and 24.0.0 stores potentially sensitive information in log files under certain situations that could be read by an authenticated user. IBM X-Force ID: 284868.

item.title: CVE-2024-38321|2024-08-03T18:49:24.893Z -- ibm -- business%20automation%20workflow
item.description: IBM Business Automation Workflow 22.0.2, 23.0.1, 23.0.2, and 24.0.0 stores potentially sensitive information in log files under certain situations that could be read by an authenticated user. IBM X-Force ID: 284868.
